title: Why not keep Magus and Runeglaive at the same time?
body:
everyone just seems to argue, that either the new jungle item shouldnt be released, or that it should replace the old one.

theyre two entirely different items, and its not like you can stack them. so whats the problem in just having both?

am i missing something obvious here?

replies.body:
ap champions are so diverse, that the notion of having 1 item for all ap junglers is kindof ridiculous.

you have everything between ap bruisers, tanks and mages who profit from ap and cdr.


magus is clearly the better item for mage junglers like fiddle, karthus and other similar champs, while runeglaive is better on nidalee, elise, eve etc.

cinderhulk and juggernaut both were designed to benefit the same type of champions. but magus and runeglaive both appeal to entire different types of champions, even though theyre both ap items.

but the real problem is, i absolutely see no point in removing either. even if just 2 or 3 champions in the game profit from magus over runeglaive, it would still be worth keeping.

If the two of the items were out at the same time, you would see nidalee's still going for magus. Nidalee scales grossly with ap so the extra 40 is nice, and tear+magus is a really nice combo compared to runeglaive+morello/athene imo

i mean except for being ap items, theyre overall benefitting 2 different types of champions.

so whats the point in removing one in favour of the other? its not even like theyre similar items, where one is just generally better than the other, but rather that theyre still completely different items.

its like saying ghostblade and cleaver are the same and only 1 can exist in the game. even though they have somewhat overlapping stats, theyre still 2 entirely different items.

I think probably because not many junglers would use them. Like, with runeglaive, the only junglers I can think of that would take Magus instead are like, Fiddlesticks, maybe Karthus (but even then the mana regen is really nice), and some manaless AP junglers. The pool of AP scaling champions who actually build damage (as oppose to tank) is still pretty low, I don't think it's wise to just fragment that further. I don't think Riot would hang onto an item just because one or two champions would use it, they're probably trying to compromise. It's not like Fiddlesticks and Karthus aren't mana hungry either. I also expect the item to change a lot before release.

I guess, though, it begs the question of why not just nerf some stats on Magus and give it some mana regen; what junglers are they targetting by giving the item a spellblade effect? Nidalee certainly doesn't need any help in jungle; the spellblade effect works best with champions that build more AP (since it has a scaling), and there aren't many AP junglers that go full damage besides Nidalee, Diana, Fiddlesticks, Karthus (for the latter two, the item already seems suboptimal, so it's not with them in mind). It's strong on Elise and Evelynn early, but they typically go tank after 1-2 damage items, so the scaling is wasted/scales poorly in the late game. I guess we'll see how it changes in upcoming patches.

who actually uses cleaver as effective as garen, pantheon and maybe wukong?

there are not many champions who make that much good use of it, while most others would probably want a last whisper with front loaded armor pen. theyre still keeping the item.

i dont see how this is different. they dont even need to worry about a stacked case scenario like the armor pen items, since jungle items are exclusive.

honestly, the loss of tenacity with juggernaut wasnt that big of a deal, because merc treads arent that expensive or difficult to fit into a build for any champion. the difference between those items is much smaller than between magus and runeglaive.

some unwritten rule, that there can only be 1 ap jungle item doesnt seem like a solid argument to me.

> who actually uses cleaver as effective as garen, pantheon and maybe wukong?

Just to jump in to answer this

Darius, Jayce, J4, Sion, Shyvanna, and Lee.
also urgot

If I'm a kiting Marksman with a lot of natural mobility and wanted both Phage and ArPen, I'd take a Black Cleaver over Trinity Force or Last Whisper.  The extra health is also useful to stay alive one more auto attack against another Marksman.  I'd prioritize Cleaver if there are a lot of immobile mages and bruisers on the enemy team.
It actually works really well on Sivir because of her ricochet. She can debuff many players at once, sometimes a whole team and follow with a boomerang blade that hits even harder as a result.

Maybe not as well, but effectively? Pretty much every AD bruiser can use Cleaver pretty well, as well as some ADCs in certain situations. Probably about as well as Fiddlesticks and Karthus can use runeglaive, especially if it gets changed in future iterations (which is very likely). Honestly, with these changes Fiddle will probably just upgrade to T2 jungle item and then get his Zhonyas faster, so he's not losing out on any bonus gold. If you *really* want to nitpick as well, machete isn't even a good item for Fiddlesticks, he just gets it because he'd miss gold otherwise. Would you have them create a complete new tree of jungle items for a single champion, even though he gets by just fine (and in fact consistently has one of the highest success rates in high elo) with the current options?

That "unwritten rule" is Occam's Razor. It's not a hard and fast rule, but it's purpose is to highlight potential inefficiencies; if you can make a jungle item that can handle all the use cases well enough, why would you have another one? Would you want tailor made items for every single champion and their offbuilds? Honestly Magus was far from a perfect jungle item to begin with, for any champion, and Runeglaive won't be perfect either.

It's the same thing with how you said the loss of juggernaut wasn't that big a deal; if the item is actually well made, only having one won't be a big deal either. The solution is to actually make a good item, not just have every single item they can imagine for the sake of it.

Why not have Juggernaut and Cinderhulk? To be honest, I have no idea, but this is how it goes.

That has nothing to do with this.

No one would get juggernaut over cinderhulk. Not a single champion.

This is different. Magus and Rune-watchamacallit do completely different things, and work on completely different champions.

You wouldn't get Jug over Cind on olaf.

You would get magus over rune on fiddlesticks.

People were making this argument when Cinder came out, they didn't want to lose the tenacity. They all shut up fairly quickly the second Cinderhulk went live. 

>You would get magus over rune on fiddlesticks.

You'd also get Juggernaut over Cinder on Elise. There is a champ who preferred Juggernaut. In the same vain Fiddle is literally the only champ who'd prefer 40 AP to the proc on the new item.

I'm still not convinced that this item's even worse on Fid though. If you just space in a single auto between your drains you get back a lot of mana. This means you can donate blue to your mid lane without OOMing in the jungle.

What does juggernaught give elise that cinderhulk doesnt? Around level 6, both enchants give the same amount of Health (while Cinderhulk gives more lategame health). 10% CDR might help clears, but so does the immolate damage - youd have a hard time getting more than 1 rotation off in a gank with her long cooldowns, even with 10% more CDR. Tenacity? Sure - ill give you that Elise likes tenacity, but so does every other jungler who thrives in the Cinderhulk meta. 
___________________________________________________________

Its not good on fiddle for the same reason that lich bane isnt good on fiddle. Magus gives fiddle 2 things he needs, AP and CDR. RuneGlaive gives less CDR, and has a autoattack passive for a non-autoattacking jungler. His base attack speed and autoattack animation are so slow that if you can chain-drain someone instead, the time it takes to autoattack and get the RuneGlaive proc (around 1 attack per second doing 70 + 30% AP lategame) would do less damage than the drain (1 second does an extra 80 + 45% AP). And thats not taking into account that fiddle's auto range is shorter than the drain range (and much shorter than the channel range). 

It might help his clears, but fiddle doesnt need help in clears. He doesnt even need chilling smite, opening the door for blasting smite, since his Fear has a very similar range to smite. 

Fiddle has been **THE ** AP carry jungler for a long time. When elise was nerfed out of top, she generally built AP Bruiser. Nidalee just recently got viable with the changes to her cougar and her reset on abilities. There just arent too many AP carry junglers in the game, and an item change that drastically affects one is making people upset. 

In comparsion, there are many bruiser/tank junglers who like Cinderhulk, and all of them like Cinderhulk over Juggernaught. Some might prefer Warrior over both, but thats not really part of this discussion.

Juggernaut gave CDR and tenacity. Dont get me wrong, I ofc think Cinderhulk is stronger then Juggernaut, but CDR and tenacity arent something you can easily forget about it.

I liked Juggernaut because I could build it with Tabi Ninjas and have tenacity. Now I'm kinda forced to buy Mercury's vs heavy CC teams.

>What does juggernaught give elise that cinderhulk doesnt?

For literally every champ who isn't Elise, nothing. Elise doesn't really value the Sunfire aura and while she doesn't mind the exess HP it's not as good on her as tenacity and CDR.

I'd say the difference in power between Cinder/Jug on Elise and Magus/Rune on Fid is about the same.

What does Magus give over Runeguard for any champ who isn't Fid? It's better to add a ratio to the vast majority of kits than it is to add 40 AP and 10% CDR. Fid's the only AP jungler I can think of who has major problems procing the spellblade effect in fights.

>Elise likes tenacity, but so does every other jungler who thrives in the Cinderhulk meta.

Sej and Gragas both give 0 fucks about tenacity. If I have my W running as Sej and you CC me you just accomplished nothing. You also just wasted your CC onto a target you can't focus down and most likely lost the fight. That's not to say that they can't use it, more just that it makes very little difference to them.

Comparatively Elise needs to AA in order to do damage, when she's CC'd she can't AA.

The point I'm making is that we're both talking about a single champ. We're talking about **THE** single champ who would prefer the old to the new.  Find me another champ who can't utilise the spellblade proc at least to some extent. I'll give you a hint, there isn't one.

It's not like Fid won't have build options anyway. Fid doesn't need to upgrade past blasting smite. He can go for a Morello's straight after to get the exact same stats, or he can rush into Hourglass which IMO has always been better.

Most junglers require AA in order to do damage, just not the supertanks with massive ults like Naut, Sej, Amumu, and Gragas (though id still argue that most of these champions benefit greatly from autoattacks, their strength is tied to their ults). Elise is not of that variety of jungler - she is more akin to Lee Sin, Udyr, Jarvan, Vi and the like, who require autos to do damage, but never built Juggernaught or any tenacity item (back when Mobis were necessary) but build cinderhulk now. 

After Elise's major nerfs, people stopped building tenacity on her with the Ancient Golem. Instead, they went Spirit of the Spectural Wraith and Sorcs to have the same early game power - the change from Juggernaught to Cinderhulk had very little effect on her. It was her repeated nerfs that destroyed her viability, not the change in items. 
__________________________________________
The problem with the 'single champion' view is that Elise has many comparable picks.m Think of the AP junglers who would use Magus - we have Nid, Diana, and Fiddle. Nid is the poke. Diana is the assassin. Fiddle is the AoE AP carry. I guess you can make an argument for Akali and Karthus, but even Karthus would get more benefit from raw AP than the lich-bane proc, while Akali doesnt need the mana (and would probably sell RuneGlaive for Lich Bane, which provides more single-target damage to synergize with her kit). 

We are talking about a smaller champion pool to choose from for AP junglers. it might be 1 champion, but its 33% of the AP junglers.

I think the fact that players are asking to keep both Magus and Runeglaive shows that neither enchantment is really the best fit for AP champions in general. Magus is getting replaced because it's an overall lackluster item, one that does nothing to answer the difficulties AP champions face in the jungle (namely mana sustain) and doesn't scale as well as it should into the late game, and while Runeglaive is good on champions like {{champion:131}}, {{champion:245}} and even {{champion:60}}, it's also one that isn't really the best fit for mages, with {{champion:9}} being the biggest outlier (he doesn't really benefit that much from current jungle items either, though), and unlike {{item:3725}}, which is universally beneficial to tanky champions in and out of the jungle, Runeglaive is likely to not have that much of an impact outside of clears, bar really autoattack-focused champions (even Elise doesn't make the best use of it when in combat with champions). I think the answer shouldn't be to have two separate AP enchantments, but rather to look for a single AP enchantment that relies more on spells, which would greatly benefit mages, obviously, but also likely help out even really autoattack-based AP junglers. Spell power is the defining trait of pretty much any AP champion, so I feel it would make sense to have the AP jungler enchantment build on that, rather than just provide raw stats, as is the case for Magus, or focus on spell-weaving and autoattacks, which Runeglaive currently does.
